definition: lit. to penetrate into a bull's horn (idiom); fig. to waste time on an insoluble or insignificant problem/to bash one's head against a brick wall/a wild goose chase/a blind alley/to split hairs
to drill/to bore/to get into/to make one's way into/to enter (a hole)/to thread one's way through/to study intensively/to dig into/to curry favor for personal gain
variant of 鑽|钻[zuan4]
an auger/diamond
surname Niu
ox/cow/bull/CL:條|条[tiao2],頭|头[tou2]/newton (abbr. for 牛頓|牛顿[niu2 dun4])/(slang) awesome
surname Jue
role (theater)/to compete/ancient three legged wine vessel/third note of pentatonic scale
angle/corner/horn/horn-shaped/unit of money equal to 0.1 yuan, or 10 cents (a dime)/CL:個|个[ge4]
point (of needle)/sharp/shrewd/pointed

sentences.english: Advice is not for the knowledge of knowledge, into a dead end.
sentences.chinese: 建议就是不要为了知识而知识，钻牛角尖。

sentences.english: Don't be too single-minded. It will only serve to bind you later on.
sentences.chinese: 别太钻牛角尖，这只会成为你日后的羁绊。

sentences.english: Ongoing from that was a phase of a propensity for depression, for compulsion, for paranoia.
sentences.chinese: 那的确是一段抑郁，容易偏执钻牛角尖的日子。

sentences.english: The fact that you want to do better with your time means you’re stuck as-is.
sentences.chinese: 事实上你想做得更好意味着你已被卡住，钻牛角尖了。

sentences.english: Does not overanalyze negative points, but instead looks for the positive points in the subject being analyzed.
sentences.chinese: 不会钻牛角尖过度悲观，能看到事物积极的一面。

definition: lit. honing a bull's horn; fig. to waste time on an insoluble or insignificant problem/to bash one's head against a brick wall/a wild goose chase/a blind alley/to split hairs/same as idiom 鑽牛角尖|钻牛角尖
obstinate/opinionated
to bring trouble on oneself (idiom)
stubborn/inflexible/one-track minded
lit. silly people get their panties in a bunch (idiom)/fig. to get upset over nothing/to make problems for oneself
to act impetuously (idiom); on an impulse
to not take to heart/to be free of worried thoughts/to adopt a lighthearted perspective/lighthearted
to be foolish/to play dumb/to gaze absentmindedly
extreme (usu. of thoughts, speech, circumstances)
emotional/sentimental
stubborn/obstinate/having a one-track mind
narrow-minded/petty
small-minded/petty/narrow-minded
to worry about personal gains and losses
erhua variant of 較真|较真[jiao4 zhen1]
to stubbornly insist on one's own ideas (idiom)
pinyin: bu4 zhuang4 nan2 qiang2 bu4 hui2 tou2
